description: Construction of a four-storey building (following the demolition of existing building) use as offices on ground floor (Use Class B1a) and community facilities on the first to third floors (Use Class D1)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers 783-000-L-000 (rev. A); 0783-000-L-X01 (rev. A); 0783-200-L-X00 (rev. B); 0783-000-L-001 (rev. A) and 0783-200-L-001 (rev. B).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning.

| Samples of materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved plans.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in order to safeguard the appearance of the building and visual amenities of the surrounding area, in accordance to the objectives of policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015) and policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| Sound limiting insulation shall be installed between the approved community centre uses (D1 use class) and the adjacent residences prior to the first occupation of the relevant part of the development, to achieve an acoustic standard not exceeding NR 25 Leq, 5mins (octaves) or NR20 Leq, 5 mins (one third octaves) inside a bedroom, and NR 30 Leq, 5 mins (octaves) or NR25 Leq, 5 mins (one third octaves) inside a habitable room when noise is generated from the non-residential uses and the sound limiting insulation shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of residential amenity is provided for the present and future occupiers of the adjacent residences, in accordance with policies 3.2 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2015); policy 1.1 (j) of Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 (2012) and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013). | Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 the development shall only be used for B1a and D1 uses and not for any other use.
Reason: To accord with the terms of the application and to protect the provision of social infrastructure uses, in accordance with policies 3.16 and 3.19 of the London Plan (2015).

| Prior to the commencement of the D1 use a sound limiting device shall be installed by an approved sound engineer to control the output from any amplification system.  The limiter device shall be permanently retained and operated according to the manufacturer's instructions and regularly maintained, such that details of maintenance checks by an approved sound engineer shall be furnished at yearly intervals, to demonstrate that the limiter is functioning properly and the settings have not been altered.

Reason: To ensure the amenity of neighbouring occupiers from adverse noise and vibration impacts in accordance with policies 7A of the Development Management DPD (2013); and policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015).

| Sheltered and secure cycle parking for at least seven cycles as indicated on approved plan 0783-200-L-001 revision B shall be in place prior to first occupation of the development hereby permitted and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for cycle parking.

Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided within the development in pursuance of the objectives of sustainability and encouraging the use of modes of transport other than private motor vehicles in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2015); policies 1.1(k) and (g) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 (2012); and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG (2012).

| The refuse and recycling storage and collection facilities shown in drawing 0783-200-L-001 revision B shall provide sufficient capacity for the occupiers of the approved community facility units and separate B1a office unit and shall be retained permanently. The refuse shall be able to be reasonably and practically collected by the Council.
Reason: In the interests of the adequate refuse and recycling storage and collection cycle for future occupiers and in accordance with policy 5.16 of the London Plan - Consolidated 2015.

| Details shall be submitted for approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced for the installation, operation and maintenance of the ventilation system. The system, as approved, shall be installed and fully operational before the first occupation of the upper floor community rooms and ground floor office B1a floor space and thereafter permanently retained and maintained in accordance with the details agreed.

Reason: To safeguard the working/living environment of neighbouring properties in accordance with policy 5.2 of the London Plan (2015) and policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
